page.title: 09The Severn Tunnel continued
page.content: {1880}Contract entered into with Mr T A Walker(who built the Manchester Ship Canal) with Sir John Hawkshaw as Chief Engineer. {1885}5 September Sir Daniel Gooch (Chairman of G.W.R) and Ladygooch and party passed through the tunnel in a special train. {1886}22 November Tunnel passed for traffic by Board of Trade. {1886}1 December First passenger train in regular service passed through the tunnel. 76,4000,000 bricks and 37,000 tons of cement used in construction of the tunnel. 3,628 men employed at busiest periods. The tunnel is: 140 ft.below general level of the rails on each side of the river, which is the lowest point on British Railways.
